item.title: Overview of 3 Dimensional Array
item.description: A multidimensional array is an array consisting of more than 2 dimensions. We can perceive three dimensions at most. To visual 3-dimensional array, let’s take an example of a cube. Therefore, the array is cube[3][3][3]. For better understanding, represent a 3-D array as a combination of 2-D arrays. Note: The two-dimensional array must have the same size. img To conclude, a three dimensional array has arr[sub-array number][row][column]. Application of 3-D array To represent real-world location co-ordinates.

item.title: Introduction to 2-D Array
item.description: Overview of two dimensional array A two-dimensional array is an array of array. For example, consider a sample time table. Here, the days are an array. Each day consists of an array within them. Thus it forms a 2-D array with 6 columns and 7 rows. The text entered in each box acts as an element. The advantages and disadvantages of a 2-dimensional array are the same as a 1-dimensional array as I mentioned in this blog on 1D Array.

item.title: Introduction To 1-D Array
item.description: One Dimensional Array Simplified Array: A data structure which stores homogenous data types in continuous memory allocation is known as an Array. It stored several related items using a single name. Different elements can be accessed using the index. Consider a cupboard in your local library. It has different sections for different genres of book. Each section can accommodate a specific number of books. Now consider the section of Mathematics wherein one would only find books on mathematics.
